attributes.action: Maintain an independent Department for International Development
attributes.additional_details:
The DfID was made independent of the FCO in 1997, solely to protect the use of aid for poverty reduction following a link between aid and a major arms deal in Malaysia. Merging the DfID - a transparent and globally respected department - with the FCO whose efficiency and transparency have scored poorly, will see a return to security-driven development. 

Aid should work independently of diplomatic and security goals, the way to ensure this is through the continued separation of the DfID and FCO.
attributes.background: The Department for International Development (DfID) has been world-leading in the global effort to end poverty. Boris Johnson's proposed merger with the Foreign & Commonwealth Office (FCO) will result in a greater focus on security over poverty reduction.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327602
